meanings.definition: The state or quality of being solid.
meanings.sent1: The solidities of the rock made it difficult to break.
meanings.sent2: The table's solidities ensured it could hold heavy books without breaking.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to jump onto the shelf, underestimating the solidities of the ceramic figurines.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the solidities of a mountain, unyielding to any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The solidities of the ice sculpture amazed the crowd with its intricate details.

meanings.definition: The ability to withstand pressure or force.
meanings.sent1: The solidities of the metal beam allowed the bridge to support heavy traffic.
meanings.sent2: The solidities of the armor protected the knight in battle.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's suit had special solidities that made him invincible to attacks.
meanings.sent4: Her resolve was a shield of solidities against the harsh criticisms.
meanings.sent5: The solidities of the ancient walls stood firm against the test of time.

meanings.sent1: The jeweler crafted beautiful jewelry from various solidities of gold.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the different solidities of rocks found in the cave.
meanings.sent3: The child's collection of toys included solidities like wooden blocks and plastic cars.
meanings.sent4: The artist's palette held a range of solidities in paint, from thick to thin.
meanings.sent5: The chef experimented with different solidities of chocolate to create the perfect dessert.
